title: Caching
description: In computing, a cache is a hardware or software component that stores data so that future requests for that data can be served faster; the data stored in a cache might be the result of an earlier computation or a copy of data stored elsewhere.
key-ideas: Caching can help improve reliability, availability.
In networks, caching will typically involve distributed systems and/or proxies.
Reduce computational load on back end.
Used in databases, CPUs, web applications/sites, web browsers.
